Instrument.name: Giotto Radioscience Experiment
Instrument.description: The scientific objectives of this experiment were to determine both the columnar electron content of Comet Halley's ionosphere and the cometary mass fluence from atmospheric drag by using the radio signals from Giotto during the Halley encounter on 13--14 March 1986. The measurements of cometary electron content and mass fluence were inverted to derive the spatial distribution of the electron and mass (dust and gas) density within Halley's coma. This experiment was an occultation-type, remote-sensing experiment which relied on the propagation effects of electromagnetic waves. The experiment took measurements of the phase (Doppler) shifts of the downlink carrier signals both at S-band (2.3 GHz) and X-band (8.4 GHz) as a function of time during the Halley encounter.
